extension.dc:title: Taxon Abundance
extension.name: TaxonAbundance
extension.dc:description: Support for taxon abundance of occurrences such as environmental samples, plot observations or collection objects with multiple species. A species abundance record is in itself an Occurrence.

property.name: recordNumber
property.dc:description: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.

property.name: recordedBy
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (recordNumber), should be listed first.
property.examples: "Oliver P. Pearson; Anita K. Pearson" where the value in recordNumber "OPP 7101" corresponds to the number for the specimen in the field catalog (collector number) of Oliver P. Pearson.

property.name: individualID
property.dc:description: An identifier for an individual or named group of individual organisms represented in the Occurrence. Meant to accommodate resampling of the same individual or group for monitoring purposes. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a data set.

property.name: individualCount
property.dc:description: The number of individuals represented present at the time of the Occurrence.

property.name: relativeTaxonAbundance
property.dc:description: The abundance of a Taxon present in a sample or plot area at the time of the Occurrence, given as a percentage between 0-100.

property.name: sex
property.dc:description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: lifeStage
property.dc:description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: reproductiveCondition
property.dc:description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: behavior
property.dc:description: A description of the behavior shown by the subject at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: establishmentMeans
property.dc:description: The process by which the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence became established at the location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: occurrenceStatus
property.dc:description: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: associatedMedia
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of media associated with the Occurrence.

property.name: associatedReferences
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the Occurrence.
property.examples: "http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261", "Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767."

property.name: associatedOccurrences
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Occurrence records and their associations to this Occurrence.

property.name: associatedSequences
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the Occurrence.

property.name: associatedTaxa
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers or names of taxa and their associations with the Occurrence.

property.name: occurrenceDetails
property.dc:description: This term is deprecated in favor over the new dcterm:references. Previously this term was used as: A reference (publication, URI) to the most detailed information available about the Occurrence.

property.name: occurrenceRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

property.name: taxonID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of taxon information (data associated with the Taxon class). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: taxonConceptID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the taxonomic concept to which the record refers - not for the nomenclatural details of a taxon.

property.name: scientificName
property.dc:description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.
property.examples: "Coleoptera" (order), "Vespertilionidae" (family), "Manis" (genus), "Ctenomys sociabilis" (genus + specificEpithet), "Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli" (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet), "Roptrocerus typographi (Györfi, 1952)" (genus + specificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship), "Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia (Torr.) J.T. Howell" (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship)

property.name: scientificNameID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

property.name: namePublishedIn
property.dc:description: A reference for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.
property.examples: "Pearson O. P., and M. I. Christie. 1985. Historia Natural, 5(37):388", "Forel, Auguste, Diagnosies provisoires de quelques espèces nouvelles de fourmis de Madagascar, récoltées par M. Grandidier., Annales de la Societe Entomologique de Belgique, Comptes-rendus des Seances 30, 1886"

property.name: namePublishedInYear
property.dc:description: The four-digit year in which the scientificName was published.

property.name: namePublishedInID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

property.name: nameAccordingTo
property.dc:description: The reference to the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied - traditionally signified by the Latin "sensu" or "sec." (from secundum, meaning "according to"). For taxa that result from identifications, a reference to the keys, monographs, experts and other sources should be given.
property.examples: "McCranie, J. R., D. B. Wake, and L. D. Wilson. 1996. The taxonomic status of Bolitoglossa schmidti, with comments on the biology of the Mesoamerican salamander Bolitoglossa dofleini (Caudata: Plethodontidae). Carib. J. Sci. 32:395-398.", "Werner Greuter 2008", "Lilljeborg 1861, Upsala Univ. Arsskrift, Math. Naturvet., pp. 4, 5"

property.name: nameAccordingToID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied. See nameAccordingTo.

property.name: acceptedNameUsage
property.dc:description: The scientificName of the taxon considered to be the valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name for this nameUsage.

property.name: parentNameUsage
property.dc:description: The scientificName representing the direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a taxonomic classification) of this taxons scientificName.

property.name: originalNameUsage
property.dc:description: The equivalent of the scientificName as it originally appeared when the name was first established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode (i.e., within the namePublishedIn reference). The basionym (botany) or basonym (bacteriology) of the scientificName or the senior/earlier homonym for replaced names.

property.name: higherClassification
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa names terminating at the rank immediately superior to the taxon referenced in the taxon record. Recommended best practice is to order the list starting with the highest rank and separating the names for each rank with a semi-colon (";").

property.name: kingdom
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: phylum
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: class
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: order
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: family
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the family in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: genus
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.

property.name: subgenus
property.dc:description: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion.

property.name: specificEpithet
property.dc:description: The name of the first or species epithet of the scientificName.

property.name: infraspecificEpithet
property.dc:description: The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet of the scientificName, excluding any rank designation.

property.name: taxonRank
property.dc:description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: verbatimTaxonRank
property.dc:description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName as it appears in the original record.

property.name: scientificNameAuthorship
property.dc:description: The authorship information for the scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable nomenclaturalCode.

property.name: vernacularName
property.dc:description: A common or vernacular name.

property.name: nomenclaturalCode
property.dc:description: The nomenclatural code (or codes in the case of an ambiregnal name) under which the scientificName is constructed. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: taxonomicStatus
property.dc:description: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the experts opinion. It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that defines the concept. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: nomenclaturalStatus
property.dc:description: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.

property.name: taxonRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.
property.examples: "this name is a misspelling in common use"

property.name: identifiedBy
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.

property.name: dateIdentified
property.dc:description: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).
property.examples: "1963-03-08T14:07-0600" is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC, "2009-02-20T08:40Z" is 20 Feb 2009 8:40am UTC, "1809-02-12" is 12 Feb 1809, "1906-06" is Jun 1906, "1971" is just that year, "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1 Mar 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC, "2007-11-13/15" is the interval between 13 Nov 2007 and 15 Nov 2007.

property.name: identificationReferences
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the Identification.
property.examples: "Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004."

property.name: identificationRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes about the Identification.
property.examples: "Distinguished between Anthus correndera and Anthus hellmayri based on the comparative lengths of the uñas."

property.name: identificationQualifier
property.dc:description: A brief phrase or a standard term ("cf.", "aff.") to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification.
property.examples: 1) For the determination "Quercus aff. agrifolia var. oxyadenia", identificationQualifier would be "aff. agrifolia var. oxyadenia" with accompanying values "Quercus" in genus, "agrifolia" in specificEpithet, "oxyadenia" in infraspecificEpithet, and "var." in rank. 2) For the determination "Quercus agrifolia cf. var. oxyadenia", identificationQualifier would be "cf. var. oxyadenia " with accompanying values "Quercus" in genus, "agrifolia" in specificEpithet, "oxyadenia" in infraspecificEpithet, and "var." in rank.

property.name: identificationVerificationStatus
property.dc:description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic identification has been verified to be correct. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID/ABCD.

property.name: identificationID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the Identification (the body of information associated with the assignment of a scientific name). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: typeStatus
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.
property.examples: "holotype of Ctenomys sociabilis. Pearson O. P., and M. I. Christie. 1985. Historia Natural, 5(37):388"

property.name: subspecf_gen_lin
property.dc:description: This should provide further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e biovar, serovar, serotype, biovar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. It can also contain alternative taxonomic information

property.name: ploidy
property.dc:description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v1.269) please refer to http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44601/?conceptid=PATO%3A0001374

property.name: num_replicons
property.dc:description: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote

property.name: extrachrom_elements
property.dc:description: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids)

property.name: estimated_size
property.dc:description: The estimated size of the genome prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period.

property.name: ref_biomaterial
property.dc:description: primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report

property.name: pathogenicity
property.dc:description: To what is the entity pathogenic.

property.name: specific_host
property.dc:description: If there is a host involved, please provide its taxid (or environmental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench etc) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host). From this we can calculate any number of groupings of hosts (e.g. animal vs plant, all fish hosts, etc)

property.name: host_spec_range
property.dc:description: The NCBI taxonomy identifier of the specific host if it is known

property.name: health_disease_stat
property.dc:description: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection. This field accepts PATO (v1.269) terms, for a browser please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44601

property.name: trophic_level
property.dc:description: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

property.name: propagation
property.dc:description: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice

property.name: encoded_traits
property.dc:description: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

property.name: rel_to_oxygen
property.dc:description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

property.name: chimera_check
property.dc:description: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point

property.name: assembly
property.dc:description: How was the assembly done (e.g. with a text based assembler like phrap or a flowgram assembler); estimated error rate associated with the finished sequences (e.g. error rate of 1 in 1000 bp); and the method of calculation

property.name: assembly_name
property.dc:description: Name/version of the assembly provided by the submitter that is used in the genome browsers and in the community

property.name: finishing_strategy
property.dc:description: Was the genome project intended to produce a complete or draft genome, Coverage, the fold coverage of the sequencing expressed as 2x, 3x, 18x etc, and how many contigs were produced for the genome
